recipe.title: Sole Goujons with Paprika Salt
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika (sweet or hot)* or 1 teaspoon regular paprika (sweet or hot)
1 cup chilled fresh seltzer or club soda
instructions: Heat oil and make paprika salt: Heat oil in a 4-quart heavy pot over moderate heat until thermometer registers 375°F. Stir together 1 tablespoon salt and half of paprika in a small bowl.
Heat oil in a 4-quart heavy pot over moderate heat until thermometer registers 375°F.
Stir together 1 tablespoon salt and half of paprika in a small bowl.

Make batter and fry fish: Pat sole dry, then cut crosswise on a diagonal into 1/2-inch-wide strips. Whisk together flour, remaining paprika, 3/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper, then whisk in seltzer. Working with 6 pieces at a time, dip fish in batter to coat, shaking off excess, and fry, turning occasionally, until golden brown and fish is just cooked through (cut a piece open to test), 3 to 4 minutes. Transfer with a slotted spoon to paper towels to drain, then sprinkle with some of paprika salt. Skim any bits of fried batter from pot and return oil to 375°F between batches. Serve remaining paprika salt on the side for dipping.

Pat sole dry, then cut crosswise on a diagonal into 1/2-inch-wide strips. Whisk together flour, remaining paprika, 3/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper, then whisk in seltzer. Working with 6 pieces at a time, dip fish in batter to coat, shaking off excess, and fry, turning occasionally, until golden brown and fish is just cooked through (cut a piece open to test), 3 to 4 minutes. Transfer with a slotted spoon to paper towels to drain, then sprinkle with some of paprika salt. Skim any bits of fried batter from pot and return oil to 375°F between batches.
Serve remaining paprika salt on the side for dipping.
